A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Honestly can't see why fanboys are hating this so much\, except that it's asking them to embrace change.

There were several aspect of the film that grated with me\, not least that General Hux has literally been reduced to the role of evil comic side kick\, however I thought his character was somewhat ridiculous in the first film.

Without giving away spoilers - there are several plot lines from the first of this series that effectively amount to dead ends\, however\, again- if you embrace the change it's easy to see that this can take the Star wars universe in a new direction.

Ultimately I felt this was a bold movie\, with some glaring flaws\, but one which rolled the dice and decided to take a chance on expanding the Star Wars canon\, and this should be applauded.
